name: Plain Set
description:
This West County Clare, Ireland set was derived from the Plain Polka Set.
Chain: Ladies give right-hand-to-right, at waist-height, in the center then left-hand-to-left to the opposite gent (who has danced into his partner's position); form and arch and the lady dances under the arch and around the gent; the gent follows the lady around at his position; ladies do not chain in the center when dancing to home; they give right hands to their original partner; the gent turns the lady anticlockwise under an arch to-place.
Swing in waltz hold.

pictureData.name: Massive cliffs off County Clare, Ireland
pictureData.author: John Finkelstein

movements.name: Lead around
movements.description: Partners take crossed hand hold in front and dance around anti-clockwise to place, the gents turning the ladies under both arms into waltz hold on the last 2 bars.

movements.name: Dance at home
movements.description: Turning twice.

movements.name: Pass through
movements.description: Partners drop hands and couples dance through each other, R to R, ladies in the centre (2 bars). On reaching the opposite place, partners take R hands and the lady turns under the gent's arm while they change places (2 bars). They then repeat this movement back to place (4bars).

movements.name: Ladies chain
movements.description: R hands in the centre and L to opposite gent who turns her clockwise underarm and dances round her. Ladies pass back R to R, give R hands to partners, and turn underarm to face centre with crossed hand hold in front.

movements.name: Half lead around and pass back
movements.description: Couples lead round anticlockwise (2 bars) and partners change places, the ladies turning clockwise under both arms, to face centre (2 bars).  Partners drop hands and couples pass through each other (2 bars). Partners again exchange places, the lady turning under the gent's R arm, and take waltz hold (2 bars).

movements.name: Advance, retire and turn across
movements.description: (4 bars), R hand in R, and turn across to the opposite place, gents passing each other L to L behind their partners while the ladies turn 1½ turns clockwise under R arm to face centre (4 bars). The movement is then repeated back to place.

movements.name: Ladies cross over
movements.description: To opposite gents (2 bars) and new couples dance in place, turning once.

movements.name: Gents chase the ladies
movements.description: They cross to their partners' R side (2 bars), take R hands and turn them 1 turn anti-clockwise underarm (2 bars). Partners take L hands and gents dance anti-clockwise round to the correct side of the ladies while ladies dance 2 turns clockwise under arm in place. They finish facing centre with crossed hand hold in front (4 bars).

movements.name: Slide and house home
movements.description: Partners take waltz hold and slide towards the couple on their R and back (4 bars) and house back home.

movements.name: Ladies chain
movements.description: Back into waltz hold.

movements.name: House within
movements.description: House within the set, the gent placing his partner alongside the 2nd gent on the 7th bar. On the 8th bar, 1st gent takes inside hands of both ladies while 2nd gent takes outside hands i.e. his partner's R in his R and 1st lady's L in his L. NOTE: The inside hands MUST BE UNDERNEATH the outside handhold.

movements.name: Advance, retire and ladies turn under
movements.description: The formation advances across the centre of the set, retires, and advances to the centre (6 bars). Both ladies ½ turn outwards under the gents' raised arms and into line with 1st gent (2 bars).

movements.name: Advance, retire and christmas
movements.description: The ladies again turning outwards under both gents' raised arms on the last 2 bars to form a little christmas in the centre of the set.

movements.name: Swing four
movements.description: Couples falling back to place on the last 2 bars.

movements.name: Ladies chain
movements.description: Back into waltz hold.

movements.name: House within
movements.description: House within the set the set to form the three-and-one formation.

movements.name: Advance, retire and ladies turn under

movements.description: Side couples now dance 2. led by 1st side couple.

movements.name: The Gallop 1/4
movements.description: Top couples, keeping waltz hold, gallop. They sidestep across the set, gents passing back to back.

movements.name: The Gallop 2/4
movements.description: Side couples gallop. They sidestep across, gents back to back.

movements.name: The Gallop 3/4
movements.description: Top couples gallop back to place, this time ladies passing back to back.

movements.name: The Gallop 4/4
movements.description: Side couples gallop back to place, ladies back to back.

movements.name: Ladies chain
movements.description: Top ladies take R hands in the centre and chain to the opposite gent. As they reach the centre, side ladies begin the same movement. All ladies give L hand to the opposite gent and turn clockwise under his arm as he dances anti-clockwise around them, all turning at the same time. Ladies dance on to the gent R of the place they chained from, giving R hand and turning once anti-clockwise under his arm and into waltz hold.
With top ladies leading the gallop.
With top ladies leading the gallop.
With top ladies leading the gallop.

movements.name: Ladies in
movements.description: All the ladies advance and retire twice.

movements.name: Gents Wheel R and L
movements.description: Gents take R hands in the centre and wheel half way around the set, turning inwards on the 4th step and taking L hands to wheel back to place.  On the last 4 bars, the ladies dance around the set to the next place on their R and turn in to face the new gent and take waltz hold.
